intro: Juncus tenuis var. dichotomus, commonly known as the narrowleaf rush, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Juncaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets of brown flowers. This plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Its stems are often branching at the base, a feature that distinguishes it from other rush species. It plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife.
